description: From German Pyrrol, corresponding to Ancient Greek πυρρός (purrhós, “reddish, fiery”)  +‎ -ole.

entries.meaning: (organic chemistry) Any of a class of aromatic heterocyclic compounds containing a ring of four carbon atoms and a nitrogen atom; especially the simplest one, C4H5N. [from 19th c.]
examples: The way the red crystals absorbed light suggested that the molecule might contain a porphyrin-like structure, a flat ring made up of four smaller rings called pyrroles […].
